title: Client doesn't launch
body:
After a week of vacation, during which patch 7.17 was released, I am not able to start the client at all. Only a pop-up of  the logo shows for a split second. Nothing else. 

Things I tried:
- Reinstall: As LoL doesn't have a good uninstaller, I tried my best with Windows. Did do a CCleaner and downloaded again. Nothing worked.
- Hextech Repair Tool: Reinstalled/Clean uninstall/repatch. At first I got a messed up version of the 'launch screen', but now I got nothing. I cannot try it again as the installation path is missing for some reason and I can't find the LeagueClient.exe file anymore.
- Windows repair: I just resetted my PC a week back, same problems.
- Some silly solution from the boards: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/IwIEcljO-league-wont-open-2017
Short: Removed the LeagueClient file. Nothing.

I am out of options, so who can help me to fix this mess?

Edit: I managed to retrieve the LeagueClient.exe from the garbage bin and put it back in the corresponding LoL map. Now the HRT just breaks down: "chromium embedded framework-error' or something when I try a reinstall.

replies.body: Soooooo it sounds like this might be a simple case of a lack of admin rights. League seems to be attempting to open, but your OS could be viewing it as unsafe and stopping it before it opens. Make sure to give League the [**permissions**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) it needs, and let me know if that still doesn't help.

I also send in a ticket and the the problem has been solved by one of your co-workers already! To potentially help others, this was his response:
> Hey there,

> theholyrVn here from Player Support, taking over!
> 
> I have a slightly longer solution for you but this will make sure that every league files is uninstalled first.
> 
> Please perform a clean boot to make sure everything goes smoothly:
> 
> Press [Windows Key] + R
> Type msconfig into the text bar at the bottom of the menu
> Click on the Services tab
> Check Hide all Microsoft services so you don't end up accidentally disabling a key process
> Click the Disable All button
> Click on the Startup tab
> Click on the Disable All button
> Click on the Apply button
> Click on the OK button
> Restart your computer
> I've put together a little guide that should be able to fix the issues. Please follow every step carefully and in the correct order.
> 
> Install Revo Uninstaller and completely remove League from your PC.
> Also make sure that you don't have an installation of League on other HDD drives.
> Get CCleaner and clean all the registries and corrupted files from your computer.
> It is of paramount importance that at this point, you reboot your PC
> 
> Download and install the DirectX End-User Runtime
> 
> It is of paramount importance that at this point, you reboot your PC
> 
> Then you'll need to re-install the game using the archived installer that I've attached to my reply
> Instructions:
> 
> 1) Download Alternate_Installer.zip
> 2) Open Alternate_Installer.zip
> 3) Open C:\
> 4) Drag & drop "Riot Games" folder into C:\
> 5) Go to the "League of Legends" folder
> 6) For easier access, Right-click LeagueClient.exe (do one or more of the following):
> 7) Create shortcut and drag & drop it to Desktop.
> 8) Pin to Taskbar
> 9) Pin to Start Menu
> 
> Reboot your PC.

I don't have that Alternate_Installer for others but I can imagine some steps can be helpfull.

Nice! Glad our techies were able to help! 

Typically those steps can get a little confusing for people when we aren't talking one on one, so I try not to go *too* in-depth here on the boards.
